alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 2:54AM MST until January 30 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snowfall accumulations of 2 to 6 inches possible. Wind chill temperatures of 20 to 30 below zero are expected Sunday night into early Monday. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Carbon and Albany counties including Rawlins, Muddy Gap, Shirley Basin, Baggs, and the central Laramie, Ferris, Seminoe, and Shirley Mountains. The highest totals will be found near higher ridgetops. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in less than 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Use caution outdoors. When outside, be sure to wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
